intro: Hieracium condensifolium, commonly known as the dense-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are narrowly lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, often with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium condensifolium is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can be invasive in certain regions.
